entry.div:
Molds of
plaster
for
wax
When your
mold of
plaster
is done & dried, take heed that your
mold
be of good release, for sometimes it happens that the animal, being wounded or thin & withered, makes wrinkles, where
retire
its scales are, where the
plaster
enters. And this not being of good release, the
wax
animal would attach itself & would break, & you would never have it perfect.
Take heed also
to make your gates for the
wax
very wide. Thus, & the gates should not be too thick. They are made when
the animal is
the
molds
have been made from both sides & the animal is outside of it.
